DOC.brief_summary: Main objective is to improve colorectal cancer (CRC) screening programme in the Czech Republic and decrease the disease incidence and mortality. The secondary aim is to verify the effectiveness of incorporation of the new minimally invasive device in the prevention programme.
DOC.brief_title: The Efficiency of Colon Capsule Endoscopy in Colon Cancer Screening
DOC.detailed_description: Multicentre, multidisciplinary (3 gastroenterology units; biostatistics department; cooperation with general practitioners), prospective study is focused on examination of individuals with average colorectal cancer (CRC) risk (asymptomatic, age 50-75 years). In years 2017 - 2019, there will be 230 persons with positive semi-quantitative immunochemical fecal occult blood tests (FIT; QuikRead, Orion Diagnostica Oy, Finland) with cut-off level 75 ng/ml involved. Every person will be examined by second generation colon capsule endoscopy (CCE2) and optical colonoscopy afterwards. Main objective is to show that the negative predictive value (NPV) of the CCE2 applied in patients with positive FIT results is sufficient to include this method in the National CRC screening as filter test with aim to reduce the necessity of subsequent optical colonoscopy.
DOC.criteria: age 50 75 years asymptomatic (no enterorhagy, weight loss or anemia) signed informed consent with the study and with colonoscopy CRC highrisk group patients having first degree relatives diagnosed with colorectal cancer at age ˂ 60 years FAP, HNPCC and other hereditary CRC syndromes probands positive personal medical history of colorectal neoplasia (advanced adenomatous polyp, colorectal cancer) recent diagnostic, followup or preventive colonoscopy in ≤ 3 years (FOBTpositive colonoscopy, screening colonoscopy) colonoscopy contraindication severe acute inflammatory bowel disease severe comorbidities; likely noncompliance of the patient no informed consent signed (with the study and/or with colonoscopy)
